featured.text: He was a victim of racism.
Marian Anderson (1897-1993) was an African American woman who gained fame as a concert singer in this climate of racism.
But Dumas overcame poverty, the lack of formal education, and the hardship of racism to become one of the world’s most popular writers.

other.text: This passage shows that Anderson finally defeated racism in the U.S. by __________.

definition.zh_def: 基於種族或民族的歧視或偏見。
definition.en_def: Prejudice or discrimination against individuals based on their race or ethnicity.
definition.example: Racism can manifest in many forms, including verbal abuse and social exclusion.
